results.definition: a person who belongs to an early stage of civilization
of or created by one without formal training; simple or naive in style
examples: primitive art such as that by Grandma Moses is often colorful and striking

results.definition: little evolved from or characteristic of an earlier ancestral type
examples: the okapi is a short-necked primitive cousin of the giraffe

results.definition: belonging to an early stage of technical development; characterized by simplicity and (often) crudeness
examples: primitive living conditions in the Appalachian mountains

results.definition: a mathematical expression from which another expression is derived
a word serving as the basis for inflected or derived forms
examples: `pick' is the primitive from which `picket' is derived

results.definition: used of preliterate or tribal or nonindustrial societies
